lead_paragraph: The New York Sanitation Department’s revised approach to prioritizing streets to be cleared of snow relies on two designations: critical and sector. The weekend blizzard tested the plan.
snippet: The New York Sanitation Department’s revised approach to prioritizing streets to be cleared of snow relies on two designations: critical and sector. The weekend blizzard tested the plan.

headline.main: New Snow-Plowing Strategy Left a ‘Mixed Bag’ in Queens
headline.print_headline: Revised Snow-Plowing Strategy Left a ‘Mixed Bag’ in Queens

abstract: New York City Sanitation Dept's failure to plow many of streets in Queens in wake of snowstorm is result of new blueprint adopted by department to handle plowing city's streets; many residents of borough have reacted with outrage and accused Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration of ignoring them in favor of Manhattan and other boroughs.
